lesson_objectives:
• Start this unit by making a fork of the starting code from here and setting up a PyCharm project
  • Read this document about Python's range statement (clicking the link will open a pdf in a new tab)
  • It extends the 1-argument form that you know to the 2 and 3-argument forms.

• In addition to the vidoe you can optionally read this document on Box-and-Pointer diagrams (clicking the link will open a pdf in a new tab)
  • It covers the same material as the video, plus a little more.
  • During class we will provide you with a printed copy of this handout to work during class time.

• Start this unit by making a fork of the starting code from here and setting up a PyCharm project
  • Next print a copy of this pdf to complete while you watch the videos for this unit. There are no questions between videos. Simply print the pdf and answer those questions while you watch the videos.
  • This video reviews the concepts of an object and a class.
• This video reviews the notation of a class in Python, as well as the concepts. It is important preparation for the next video.

• This is the new stuff (but the previous videos are super-important preparation without which this video will make no sense).
  • It shows all the basics of how to implement a class, using a Point class as an example.
  • In your in-class on-the-computer exercises, you will do an extended example that starts where this video leaves off.
